text:
Indian Coast Guard ship C-411, a frontline ship in the Indian Coast Guard (ICG) North West Region, while on patrol near the Indo-Pakistan International Maritime Boundary Line off Jakhau, apprehended a Pakistani fishing boat ‘Al Shenaz’ after it intruded into the Indian waters.

The boat was approximately 30 nautical miles west off Jakhau coast and had about 3,000 kg of fresh fish. After being spotted by the ICG ship, the crew members of the Pakistani fleet tried to return to the Pakistani waters, but apprehended by the ICG, who carried out a thorough investigation. The ICG apprehended all 11 crew, including master (Ali Asgar), all from Pakistan, for allegedly violating the Maritime Zones of India Act. — ANI
title: Pak. boat seized, 11 crew detained
